Class List
Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
hbt::BoolInverterThis class provides a simple way to invert a bool value transmitted through Signals & Slots system
hbt::ClockThis class provides a high-resolution timer and the tools to control it
hbt::ClockEventThis derived class of Event provides a way to pack informations related to Clock instances
hbt::ClockManagerThis singleton class updates and manages all registered Clock instances
hbt::ClockManagerEventThis derived class of Event provides a way to pack informations related to ClockManager instances
hbt::ClockPlusThis derived class of Clock provides some methods unusual to the standard Clock
hbt::EventThis class is a base class for all derived "Event" classes
hbt::EventTypeThis class returns a singleton with a unique identifier for each registered event type
hbt::FunctionDelegate< Tr, Args >This class registers function pointers
hbt::FunctorDelegate< C, Args >This class registers functor pointers
hbt::IDelegate< Args >This abstract class aggregates method, functions and functor pointers under a unique type
hbt::ISignalThis abstract class aggregates all Signal types under a unique type
hbt::MethodDelegate< C, Tr, Args >This class registers class member method pointers
hbt::PrintManagerThis singleton class provides a stream manager to dispatch stream inputs
hbt::PrintStreamThis class provides an easy way to send messages to the PrintManager
hbt::PrintToFileThis class writes strings into log files
hbt::SceneLoaderThis class provides a way to parse Ogre3D .scene generated by Blender
hbt::Signal< Tr(Args...)>This class can be connected to functions, functors and methods in order to dispatch event calls
hbt::SignalManagerThis singleton class manages and fires delayed events
hbt::tUnpack< i >This static class unpacks tuples, and transmits unpacked arguments using the provided member method, function or functor
hbt::ValueRestricter< T >This class provides a simple way to restrict values transmitted through Signals & Slots system to the given minimum and maximum values
